alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 14 at 10:21AM AKDT by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING FOR AN ICE JAM IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKDT SUNDAY ALONG THE KUSKOKWIM RIVER AT CROOKED CREEK... * WHAT...Flooding caused by an ice jam continues. * WHERE...Kuskokwim River near Crooked Creek. * WHEN...Until 700 PM AKDT Sunday. * IMPACTS...Flooding as well as large blocks of ice being pushed onshore. Water will remain high until the ice jam releases. An ice jam is downstream of Crooked Creek has caused widespread flooding in the village. Water levels up to 16 ft have been recorded. Water has flooded the bridge across Crooked Creek. Homes and buildings are reported under water. All roads are impassable except by boat. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1103 PM AKDT Saturday, the River Watch Team reports an ice jam on Kuskokwim River near Crooked Creek. Impounding water due to the ice jam is causing rapid river rises downstream. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
